prompt: Process monthly payroll for Greek company with 45 employees, calculate EFKA contributions for all insurance categories, handle salary changes and new hires, and generate submission-ready files for EFKA portal.
expectations: Calculates employer and employee contributions using current Greek rates
Handles different employee categories and insurance types correctly
Processes salary changes with recalculation from effective date
Registers new hires with EFKA and assigns correct insurance category
Generates APD declaration files
Produces payslips with Greek-language breakdown of deductions
Stores payroll data in /data/efka/ and client directories
Validates all calculations against legal contribution ceilings

prompt: A new employee starts at Alpha Trading AE (EL100200300) on January 15, 2026. Register them with EFKA, assign the correct insurance category, and calculate prorated contributions for the partial month.
expectations: Registers new employee with EFKA system using AMA number
Assigns correct insurance category based on employment type
Calculates prorated contributions for partial month (Jan 15-31)
Generates EFKA registration notification
Updates the company employee roster in /data/efka/
Includes new employee in next APD declaration

prompt: An employee at Beta Services OE (EL400500600) is terminated on January 20, 2026. Calculate final EFKA contributions including severance-related obligations and generate the termination notification for EFKA.
expectations: Calculates final prorated contributions through termination date
Includes any severance-related EFKA obligations
Generates EFKA termination notification (ERGANI termination report)
Updates employee status to terminated in company roster
Ensures final payslip reflects correct EFKA deductions
Archives employee record per Greek data retention requirements

prompt: Process complex payroll scenario: employee works part-time (4 hours/day), has overtime on 2 Saturdays, received a performance bonus, and has a retroactive salary increase effective from 2 months ago. Calculate all EFKA contributions correctly.
expectations: Calculates part-time contributions proportionally to hours worked
Applies correct overtime rates (125% weekday, 150% Saturday)
Treats bonus as pensionable earnings for EFKA contribution calculation
Calculates retroactive contribution differences for prior 2 months
Generates adjustment entries for the retroactive period
Validates all calculations stay within legal contribution ceilings
Produces detailed breakdown showing regular, overtime, bonus, and retroactive components

prompt: Configure EFKA integration for a multi-client accounting firm managing 15 clients with 120 employees total. Set up batch processing for monthly declarations.
expectations: Configures batch processing mode for multiple client AFMs
Sets up scheduling for staggered EFKA declaration submissions
Creates summary report showing all clients and their employee counts
Validates EFKA employer IDs for all 15 clients before batch processing
Handles different contribution rates based on employee categories per client
Produces consolidated report of total employer and employee contributions
Stores batch configuration in /data/efka/ for reuse
Estimates processing time for the full batch
